title: Advanced SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Gianluca Fiorelli September 12, 2014 Teach Google About Your Entities by Using Topical Hubs Advanced SEO | Whiteboard Friday We don't need to create heaps of pages to target long-tail keywords. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Moz associate (and long-time community member) Gianluca Fiorelli explains how we can use topical hubs and an entity-based approach to tell Google about connections it might otherwise have missed. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard September 8, 2014 The Big List of SEO Tips and Tricks for Using HTTPS on Your Website Technical SEO | Advanced SEO It’s rare when Google reveals any of its actual ranking factors, so it came as a big surprise when representatives announced they would reward sites using HTTPS encryption with a boost in search results. HTTPS isn’t like other ranking factors. Implementing it requires complexity, risks, and costs. Webmasters balance this out with benefits that include increased security, better referral data, and a possible boost in rankings. Read this post By: Cosette Jarrett September 4, 2014 3 Solid Reasons You Should Ditch Icon Images for Fonts Advanced SEO | SEO Tools | Design Still not ready to dump your icon images? I know it’s hard. That’s why I’ve provided my team’s three solid reasons for ditching icon images and replacing them with their newer, better-looking version - icon fonts: Read this post By: Marie Haynes August 26, 2014 Negative SEO: Should You Be Worried? If Attacked, What Should You Do? Link Building | Advanced SEO Many rumors have spread about negative SEO. Should we be worried? How should we protect our sites? This post paints a comprehensive picture to help put concerns to rest. Read this post By: Phil Nottingham August 25, 2014 Video SEO in a Post-Rich Snippet World Advanced SEO | Video Back in July, Google rolled out a bunch of changes in the way they treat rich snippets in the search results. One of these shifts was to dramatically scale back the prevalence of video snippets in universal search results, restricting them exclusively to domains where video is the core offering of the site. What does this mean for video SEO? Should you now move all your videos to YouTube? Read this post By: Roger MozBot August 20, 2014 Google Webmaster Tools Just Got a Lot More Important for Link Discovery and Cleanup Advanced SEO Are you seeing links drop off in third-party tools, yet they're still showing in Google Webmaster Tools? Here's the sneaky thing that may be happening. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard August 12, 2014 We Removed a Major Website from Google Search, for Science! Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO What happens when you accidentally de-index your site from Google, on purpose? We decided to find out for ourselves by removing Followerwonk from search results. Here's what we learned. Read this post By: Anthony Coraggio August 11, 2014 Beyond Search: Unifying PPC and SEO on the Display Network Advanced SEO | Online Advertising | Paid Search Marketing (PPC) PPC and SEO go better together. By playing both sides of the coin, it's possible to make more connections and achieve greater success in your online marketing than with either alone. Join me in taking the leap beyond the SERPs in unifying your paid and organic marketing! Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard August 5, 2014 What Happened after Google Pulled Author and Video Snippets: A Moz Case Study Advanced SEO | Search Engines In the past 2 months Google made big changes to its search results. Webmasters saw lost both authorship photos and video snippets. Here at Moz, we've closely monitored our traffic to our own URLs to measure the effect of these changes on our actual traffic. The results surprised us. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers July 31, 2014 The Month Google Shook the SERPs Local SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO In the month between June 28th and July 28th, Google made four major changes: (1) dropping authorship photos, (2) doubling In-depth, (3) removing many video snippets, and (4) the "Pigeon" update. Read this post By: Jason Acidre July 30, 2014 Using Modern SEO to Build Brand Authority Advanced SEO | Branding SEOs have a leg up in the branding game, as SEO and branding are far more intertwined than most people realize. This post shows you how to align those efforts to compound your return. Read this post By: Bill Slawski July 29, 2014 Unraveling Panda Patterns Advanced SEO | Search Engines I'm going to be asking you to take over as Panda for a little while to see if you can identify the kinds of things that Google's Navneet Panda addressed when faced with what looked like an incomplete patent created to identify high quality sites. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 25, 2014 How Do I Successfully Run SEO Tests On My Website? Advanced SEO | Whiteboard Friday In today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand describes three aspects of experiments we should all keep in mind to ensure valid results. He goes on to offer up several ideas for tests you can begin today! Read this post By: Tudor Bastea July 21, 2014 Reinclude Your Content in Google in Less Than 4 Hours Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO Yikes! We accidentally deindexed our site. Here's how we got it back in Google's index within a few hours. Read this post
